titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 492: Assise del alta corte del regno di Hierusalem et Cypro, tradutte da francese m'lingua italiana, de ordine dela serenissimo ducal signoria de Venetia

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Oversize Ms. Codex 492: Assise del alta corte del regno di Hierusalem et Cypro, tradutte da francese m'lingua italiana, de ordine dela serenissimo ducal signoria de Venetia are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: Title from caption title (f. 23v) and Zacour-Hirsch; abbreviated title on f. 18r.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Translation from the French text of Jean d'Ibelin, by Florio Bustron (cf. f. 23v). The date of this manuscript, before the printing of 1535, suggests that this may be the holograph of Florio Bustron.

msItem.title: Assise del alta corte del regno di Hierusalem et Cypro, tradutte da francese m'lingua italiana, de ordine dela serenissimo ducal signoria de Venetia

supportDesc.extent: 349 leaves : 300 x 215 (223 x 145) mm. bound to 314 x 220 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i (17th-century paper) + 349 + i (17th-century paper); [1-349]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in an italic script by one hand, with notes in a second hand dated 1535 (f. 23r-v, f. 349).

origin.p: Written in Cyprus or Venice, 3 January 1533 (Zacour-Hirsch).

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Sir Harry Luke (bookplate, La vertu est la seule noblesse, inside upper cover).
